books.title: The Design of Everyday Things
books.summary: The Design of Everyday Things shows that good, usable design is possible. It explains how, by making things visible, exploiting natural relationships that couple function and control, and making intelligent use of constraints, designers can produce appliances and other devices that are easy to use and understand.

books.title: Lean UX: Applying Lean Principles to Improve User Experience

This book helps you reduce waste, enhance team collaboration, and focus on outcomes rather than outputs. With case studies and actionable advice, Lean UX is an essential guide for designers and developers alike.

books.title: Don't Make Me Think (Original)
books.summary: A classic introduction to user experience and design principles. This edition laid the foundation for web and mobile usability, stressing the importance of intuitive navigation and user-centered design. An essential read for anyone looking to create user-friendly interfaces.

books.title: Seductive Interaction Design: Creating Playful, Fun, and Effective User Experiences
books.summary: This book explains how to create websites that grab attention and engage users with elements of playfulness and fun. Through case studies and examples, it explores the art of balancing aesthetics and functionality to create memorable experiences.
